Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2012 05:58AM payheav wrote: I too was diagnosed with the same cancer in 2009, The cancer was in the right breast but i choose to have both of them removed. I did 6 rounds of chemo and 20 radiation treatments. Just last week I was diagnosed with Mets breast cancer, it is in my lung right now.  Research your treatment opions before you go ahead with anything.
Posts.Title: I tried, but I don't get it.. lostinmo lago

Posts.Content: payheav wrote: I was 28 years old when I found out i I had stage 3 breast cancer in the right breast. I had both breast removed (my choice).  \It was followed by 6 chemo and 20 radiation. March 4 this year would have been 2 years remision but March 4 I was told I have mets. It is in my right lung right now, 5 tumors.  I also broke a rib 14 weeks ago and it is not healing, even tho there is no toumor showing the doctors feeling it is cacner and want to do radiation for the pain.  I am now 31 years old, told I would never have children but guess what she is 3 months old. I have a step daughter as well who is 9 and my heart is aching  for them. I was told \i had 2-3 years to live with chemo's help.  I want to live as long as I can so if anyone out there has been in my shoes and has any advice to give me Please do so.  I have some people telling me to avoid chemo-- and do things natural changing my diet and stuff.  Anyways thought this would be a good place to get help thanks everyone Dx 3/2/2012, 3cm, Stage IV, mets Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Mets breast cancer payheav CoolBreeze
